articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.title: Fed on hold, but will financial risks matter?
articles.description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials may be in broad agreement that interest rates are unlikely to change soon, but they differed Monday on how concerned they are about developing financial risks in assessing when a rate hike might be appropriate.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - U.S. Federal Reserve officials may be in broad agreement that interest rates are unlikely to change soon, but they differed Monday on how concerned they are about developing financial risks in assessing when a rate hike might be appropriate.

articles.author: Stefanie Eschenbacher
articles.title: Political vacuum in Haiti could let president rule single-handedly
articles.description: Haitian President Jovenel Moise could be ruling by decree later this week, a scenario he said would help break the Caribbean nation's political deadlock but which critics fear will undermine its fragile democracy.
articles.content:
PORT-AU-PRINCE (Reuters) - Haitian President Jovenel Moise could be ruling by decree later this week, a scenario he said would help break the Caribbean nation’s political deadlock but which critics fear will undermine its fragile democracy.

articles.title: Iran arrests son of a Green movement opposition leader: website
articles.description: The son of a leader of Iran's opposition Green movement was arrested on Monday, according to website Sahamnews.
articles.content:

articles.title: Fed's Bostic: 'High bar' to any rate hike given need to raise inflation
articles.description: There is a "high bar" to the U.S. Federal Reserve raising interest rates given the need to raise inflation and guard against any drop in inflation expectations, Atlanta Fed president Raphael Bostic said on Monday.

articles.title: Gigi Hadid: 'I'm not allowed to talk about jury duty, I'm sorry'

articles.title: Iran signals Canada could play active role in probe of downed plane, official says
